node.title: Defence Minister says China 'sees us as a tributary state' that should submit to its power
node.alt: Peter Dutton speaking against a white background.
node.description: The Defence Minister says China sees Australia and other countries in the region as subordinate states that should be submissive to it, as he warns Beijing would quickly dominate Asia if it succeeds in invading Taiwan.
node.content:
["The Defence Minister Peter Dutton has declared\u00a0that China sees other countries in the region as \"tributary states\" and is warning that Beijing would quickly dominate Asia if it succeeds in invading\u00a0Taiwan.\u00a0", "Mr Dutton said Australia's main desire was to secure peace through deterring China from aggression, with the help of other neighbouring countries.\u00a0", "However, he said, if China took control of Taiwan, it would then quickly seize other disputed areas, including the Senkaku Islands, which are claimed by both China and Japan.\u00a0", "\"The point I make is the regional order on which our prosperity and security is founded would change almost overnight,\" he told the National Press Club.", "\"In the absence of a counter-pressure, the Chinese government becomes the sole security and economic partner for Indo-Pacific nations. Now, that is a perilous military and economic situation for our country, but for so many more.", "Labor has slammed Mr Dutton's recent declaration that it was \"inconceivable\" Australia wouldn't join the United States if there was a war over Taiwan, accusing the Defence Minister of stoking tensions with China for electoral gain.\u00a0", "However, Mr Dutton said that, while Australia was \"striving for peace\" and \"striving for deterrence\", the region had to calculate the costs of inaction.\u00a0", "\"Yes, there would be a terrible price of action, but the analysis must also extend to the price of inaction,\"\u00a0he said.\u00a0", "\"If Taiwan is taken then surely the Senkakus are next. Please don't rely on your imagination. The Chinese Communist Party could not be any clearer \u2014\u00a0not always with their words, but certainly with their actions.\"\u00a0", "Mr Dutton again slammed China for its militarisation of the South China Sea, its crackdown on Hong Kong and the intrusions of Chinese coastguard\u00a0ships into disputed waters of the East China Sea.", "", "
China has recently flown fighter jets towards Taiwan in an escalation of tensions at the border.(AP:\u00a0Jin Danhua/Xinhua)
", "He also said his comment about it being \"inconceivable\" that Australia wouldn't join the United States did not amount to a formal pre-commitment to fight in a future war but was a statement of the Coalition's trust in the US-Australia Alliance.", "\"Under the Alliance, regardless of who is in government on that day, [Australia]\u00a0would have to make a decision in our country's best interests and other equities we would consider at the time, including the relationship with the US and other partners, whether we would enter into that conflict or that campaign or that blockade or whatever it might be,\" Mr Dutton\u00a0said.", "\"And none of that is contemplated or known.\"\u00a0"]
